embeds.title: Fifth Seal
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

​~~- **Ethereal**  -~~ **Seal.**
At the end of combat, **Upgrade** a random card in your deck.

messages.content: Lesson larned but better
your fate is sealed
welcome to the upgraded deck
it's just lesson learned but as a power so yeah this card is pretty good
also works well for getting the broken seal since it will upgrade all the other seals
it's also better than lesson learned because cute seal
this is such a great card 10/10 no notes
they are a very hardworking blacksmith seal
balancing idea: seals 3 and 4 should cost 2, seal 5 should cost 3 and seal 6 should cost 4
all of those except 3rd seal would be undraftable without snecko eye
or runic pyramid
seals 1 and 2 are average, every other one is too good to be true
that's more of a reason to change the effects than to make them insanely expensive to the point of not ever being worth playing
hard disagree. I would still take 3 and 5 without any plans for broken seal.
I'm not spending all my energy for a single turn on a random upgrade unless I have a ton of block from afterlife.
And I mean a ton.

this card upgrades your entire deck in half of your hexaghost runs. Its obtainable through 6th seal and worth keeping (a second copy) even after breaking the seal just to have all of your cards upgraded. I've kept 2 of these in my deck before to get 40+ card decks fully upgraded by the later end of act 3. The only draw back this card (and the other seals) has is that it does nothing in the games last fight but thats a really marginal downside that much cards that are much weaker then this also have, so its really not something to worry about for one of hexaghosts very best cards.
I would go as far to say that 5th seal is acutally better then 3rd seal, although your going to end up with both cards anyways most of the time.
I've gotta disagree here tbh. Hexa honestly doesn't have that great upgrades. If this was on hermit, I would agree 100% though.
hexaghost has some very important upgrades

Sear, Incineration, Flames from Beyond, Radiant Flame, Fast Forward, Sword of the Night, Shield of the Night, Hexaguard, Volcano Visage, Searing Wound, Gifts from Beyond, Turn it Up, Toasty, Devil's Dance (flat out needs upgrade to function), Infinite Power, Bright Ritual
Not every card is forked flame.
but every card ***is*** ghost shield
Ghost Shield is ALSO a good upgrade.
:O
3+ block that carries over.

not only is this strong, it's also fun

This is quite similar to lesson learned from watcher (which is an insanely strong card), but with a few key differences. As a seal, it can help you to create the powerful broken seal relic, and you will have extra opportunities to draft it from sixth seal and third seal. I believe that 5th seal is powerful enough on it's own as an upgrade machine that you don't even need to be going after seal exodia in order to take it, it's more than good enough all on it's own. That's the other thing, you just play this and it works. Lesson Learned is more difficult to time correctly on watcher, especially as you start going fruther into the spire and facing enemies with bigger health pools that are harder to get the fatal trigger from. If you have runic pyramid, meditate, or are just running a very thin deck, than you can usually land lesson learned even fairly late into the run, but there will be plenty of fights where it's awkward to wait for it to shuffle back in if you draw it too early, or where it's too far down, and you have to take damage if you are going to wait to draw it and metascale. 

Fifth seal has none of those problems, you just need to play it, and it works, though it doesn't deal any damage. Sure, you're down 2 energy for the turn and had no immediate impact, but afterlife (specifically ghost shield and hexaguard) will often cover that sort of play very naturally, and allow you to do it without losing much health. Sword and Shield of night also both provide excellent coverage for a slow scaling power like this, and you could even gain block if you play it while on the bolstering ghostflame. This makes pretty much all the seals very nearly "free" metascaling for hexaghost, as you will very frequently be able to play them safely, and you naturally have a very strong early game thanks to afterlife. They can even all (or partially if you draft backup copies of specific ones) get out of the way before late game if you assemble broken seal.

Hexaghost does probably have slightly worse upgrades than other classes, with the seals themselves being fairly poor upgrades, and some of the afterlife cards can be bad upgrades since you only get the benefit once most of the time. I really don't think this should stop you from picking 5th seal very highly (I would probably buy this from most shops if I could afford it, I would definitely take it from a heart bonus, one of the better rares to grab from an act boss). Upgrading all (or most) of your cards is still just incredibly strong and can make you incredibly powerful as you progress through a run. Great with snecko eye, fusion hammer, bolster rod, mummified hand, and any source of the 4th energy. I'm fairly certain this card would still be excellent even if it cost 3 energy, it just synergizes so well with afterlife (ghost shield), and the effect is really strong.
